text: long-term restrictions are being eased
again in England the government says
leisure facilities and beauty salons can
reopen gradually over the coming weeks
starting with outdoor swimming pools on
Saturday and some grassroots sports will
be able to return like cricket
from Monday beauticians and tattooists
can go back to work
spars and tanning salons can open their
doors again but there'll be restrictions
for high-risk treatments like facials
and on the 25th of July indoor pools
gyms and other sports facilities will
reopen Sara Coker reports from a Sports
Center in Alden lifeguards practicing
their rescue skills open your eyes
fitness instructors learning first-aid
gym staff making a welcome back video
for customers this community leisure
center in Oldham is ready to open its
doors after a hundred and eleven days in
hibernation I'm over the moon for those
living nearby he can't come soon enough
we always used to parent and baby
classes with my little girl as well and
we was hoping to be able to start around
a proper swimming lesson soon as well
it's accessible for all the community
and I said I'm friends can afford it
doesn't really matter what kind of job
you do you can afford it because they've
got different schemes this is one of six
centers run by a charitable trust for
Oldham council every week they're closed
the trust loses a hundred thousand
pounds and the recovery will be slow
there is a long way to go it's the start
of a journey and it will be difficult we
will be losing money hand over fist and
in the first few months as we build back
up to to normal levels a lot of the
activities that we've done before
lockdown like spectator events in the
hall or team sports for example they'll
be coming on stream further down the
line those working in gyms pools and
beauty salons have been frustrated
they've had to wait longer to reopen
lifeguard Jordan is keeping her skills
up to date but her main job is running a
nail salon I just feel like it's been
looked at as if
it's not really that important but
realistic clear like is people's
livelihoods and we all come not wait to
get back and just get out or just
obviously make all the people happy as
well as being out earn money and make
ourselves happy gyms and leisure centers
have been planning and rehearsing how to
reopen for weeks now here they've moved
exercise bikes into a bigger space so
people can socially distance and they
also come with hand sanitizer but the
big unknown is where the customers will
want to return to gyms after they've got
used to exercising at home or outdoors
if we can convince people when we reopen
to come and see that we can operate very
safely and we do believe we've got very
stringent cleaning regime in place and
if people can see that people understand
that I'm not worried about renewals so
the 25th of July is the date many gym
goers have been waiting for the industry
now has just over two weeks to prepare
and bring tens of thousands of staff
back from furlough Sarah cocoa BBC News
in Oldham and restrictions are being
eased too for the performing arts in
England some changes are coming in from
this Saturday
our correspondent Colleen Harris Harris
joins me now live theater live music
slowly returning that's right so
theaters operas dance and music events
all outdoor for now but of course
there's going to have to be some special
measures in place so fewer people
allowed to watch eticket Inc to help
with track and trace and a deep-clean
after every performance for those venues
they're also working hard to get indoor
performances back up and running again
so they're trying some small indoor
events with social distance audiences to
work out how to usher people in safely
and what have we not been doing or
seeing during lockdown that's singing
together we've all seen those zoom
choirs well some singing and playing of
brass and wind instruments will be
allowed under managed and controlled
environment and health experts will be
testing some of those to ensure that the
virus isn't transmitted and all of this
follows Sunday's announcement of a one
and a half billion pounds rescue package
for the Arts there's still no detail
yet about how that money will be
distributed or how soon but finally some
progress Coleen Harris thank you
